meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of static electricity.
meanings.sent1: The balloon stuck to the wall because it was staticky.
meanings.sent2: Her hair stood on end from the staticky sweater.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur became staticky after rubbing against the blanket.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a staticky charge in the air.
meanings.sent5: The staticky socks crackled with each step she took.

meanings.definition: Full of or producing static electricity.
meanings.sent1: The dry winter air made everything feel staticky.
meanings.sent2: The old TV screen was so staticky, you could hear the crackling.
meanings.sent3: The staticky blanket made sparks when she touched it.
meanings.sent4: The staticky balloon clung to the ceiling like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: His clothes were always staticky after doing laundry.

meanings.definition: Having a crackling or hissing sound.
meanings.sent1: The staticky radio station was hard to listen to.
meanings.sent2: The campfire had a staticky sound as the wood crackled.
meanings.sent3: The staticky noise from the speakers startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The staticky leaves underfoot sounded like a tiny fire.
meanings.sent5: The staticky sound of the old record player filled the room.
